bugs.title: üéØ Mission 1: The Typo Trap
bugs.description: Welcome, Debug Agent! Your first mission: A critical typo has crashed the greeting system. The client is furious! Find and fix the bug before it's too late.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è MISSION COMPLETE! The enemy? A sneaky uppercase letter! Java is case-sensitive - it's println (lowercase L, lowercase N), not printIn. This trap catches many agents on their first mission!

bugs.title: üîí The Semicolon Heist
bugs.description: ALERT: Someone stole a semicolon! The code vault is now broken. Recover the missing punctuation to restore order.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è CASE CLOSED! The missing semicolon was hiding in plain sight. Every Java statement needs its semicolon - it's like the period at the end of a sentence!

bugs.title: üëª The Ghost Variable
bugs.description: Spooky! A variable appeared out of nowhere without being declared. The compiler is haunted and refuses to run. Exorcise this bug!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è GHOST BUSTED! Variables need to be declared with their type before use. 'int x = 10;' gives the ghost a proper identity!

bugs.title: üíî The Quote Mismatch
bugs.description: A forbidden love story: Single quotes and strings don't belong together in Java! Reunite the string with its proper double quotes.
bugs.brokenCode: String name = 'John';
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è LOVE RESTORED! In Java, strings use double quotes ("). Single quotes (') are only for single characters (char type). A beautiful reunion!
bugs.fixedCode: String name = "John";

bugs.title: üî† The Case of the Missing Capital
bugs.description: Detective work needed! A lowercase 's' is impersonating an uppercase 'S'. Java is not fooled. Crack the case!
bugs.brokenCode:
string message = "Hello";
System.out.println(message);
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è IMPOSTER CAUGHT! Java class names are case-sensitive. The String class wears a capital S with pride!
bugs.fixedCode:
String message = "Hello";
System.out.println(message);

bugs.title: ‚ö° The Static Shock
bugs.description: DANGER! The main method lost its static electricity. Without it, Java can't start the program. Restore the power!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è POWER RESTORED! The main method needs 'public static void main' - without 'static', Java can't find the program's entry point!

bugs.title: üé¢ The Off-By-One Rollercoaster
bugs.description: The loop stopped one station too early! Passengers are stuck at 9 when they need to reach 10. Extend the track!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è TRACK EXTENDED! The classic off-by-one error. Change i < 10 to i <= 10 to include the final stop!

bugs.title: ‚ôæÔ∏è The Infinity Loop Trap
bugs.description: CODE RED! This countdown is going UP instead of down, creating an infinite loop! Reverse the direction before the system overheats!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è CRISIS AVERTED! The loop was incrementing (i++) but checking i > 0. Change to i-- for a proper countdown!

bugs.title: üîÑ The Frozen Counter
bugs.description: The counter is frozen in time! It keeps printing 0 forever because nobody remembers to increment it. Thaw it out!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è COUNTER UNFROZEN! Always remember to modify your loop variable! Add count++ inside the loop.

bugs.title: üì¶ The Array Out of Bounds
bugs.description: WARNING: Index out of bounds! The array has 3 slots (0, 1, 2) but someone's trying to access slot 3. Fix the navigation!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è NAVIGATION FIXED! Arrays are 0-indexed. Start at 0 and use < length (not <=). Remember: first seat is 0, not 1!

bugs.title: ‚öñÔ∏è The Equality Deception
bugs.description: The password check is failing even with the correct password! Something's wrong with how we compare secrets...
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SECURITY RESTORED! == compares memory addresses, not content. Use .equals() to compare String values!

bugs.title: üíÄ The NullPointer Assassin
bugs.description: FATALITY! A null reference just crashed the entire system. Defend against this silent killer!
bugs.brokenCode:
String name = null;
int length = name.length();
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è DEFENSE SUCCESSFUL! Always check for null before calling methods. Use ternary operator for safety!
bugs.fixedCode:
String name = null;
int length = (name != null) ? name.length() : 0;

bugs.title: ‚ûó The Integer Division Trap
bugs.description: Math mystery: (5 + 2) / 2 should be 3.5, but Java says 3.0! Who's eating our decimal?
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è DECIMALS SAVED! Integer divided by integer = integer (truncated). Divide by 2.0 to get a double!

bugs.title: üîÄ The Logic Gate Failure
bugs.description: BUG REPORT: Age -5 is being accepted as valid! The logic gates are malfunctioning. Fix the boolean operator!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è GATES REPAIRED! OR (||) means EITHER condition passes. Use AND (&&) when BOTH must be true!

bugs.title: üîÉ The Eternal True
bugs.description: This function always returns true, even for odd numbers! Someone copy-pasted wrong. Find the lie!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è TRUTH RESTORED! Classic copy-paste bug. The second return should be false for odd numbers!

bugs.title: üèÉ The Fence Post Problem
bugs.description: Trying to get the last element but hitting a wall! Arrays have a fence post problem you need to understand.
bugs.brokenCode:
int[] arr = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int last = arr[arr.length];
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è FENCE NAVIGATED! arr.length is 5, but indices go 0-4. Use arr.length - 1 for the last element!
bugs.fixedCode:
int[] arr = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int last = arr[arr.length - 1];

bugs.title: ü™û The Clone Conspiracy
bugs.description: Plot twist: The 'copy' and original are the same object in disguise! Changes to one affect both. Expose the deception!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è CONSPIRACY EXPOSED! Assignment copies the reference, not data. Use Arrays.copyOf() for a true clone!

bugs.title: üìã The List's Last Stand
bugs.description: ArrayList rebellion! Trying to get the last item with size() causes an exception. Off by one, again!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è REBELLION QUELLED! size() returns 2, but valid indices are 0 and 1. Use size() - 1!

bugs.title: üó∫Ô∏è The Map's Missing Key
bugs.description: NPE alert! We're trying to increment a counter that doesn't exist yet. The map returns null for missing keys!
bugs.brokenCode:
Map<String, Integer> counts = new HashMap<>();
counts.put("apple", counts.get("apple") + 1);
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è KEY FOUND! get() returns null for missing keys. Use getOrDefault(key, 0) for safe access!
bugs.fixedCode:
Map<String, Integer> counts = new HashMap<>();
counts.put("apple", counts.getOrDefault("apple", 0) + 1);

bugs.title: üí• The Concurrent Catastrophe
bugs.description: DISASTER! Removing items while iterating causes chaos. The collection is fighting back with ConcurrentModificationException!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è ORDER RESTORED! Can't modify while iterating with for-each. Use removeIf() for elegant removal!
bugs.fixedCode:
List<Integer> nums = new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3, 4));
nums.removeIf(n -> n % 2 == 0);

bugs.title: üéø The Switch Fall-Through
bugs.description: Monday is returning Wednesday! The switch cases are falling through like dominoes. Stop the chain reaction!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è FALL STOPPED! Without break, switch falls through to next cases. Add break after each case!

bugs.title: üë§ The Shadow Variable
bugs.description: The counter never increments! A local variable is shadowing the field, stealing all the updates.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SHADOW REVEALED! 'int count' creates a new local variable. Remove 'int' to update the field!

bugs.title: üîå The Static Disconnect
bugs.description: Static method trying to access instance variable - like a ghost trying to touch the living world!
bugs.actualOutput: Error: non-static variable cannot be referenced
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è CONNECTION ESTABLISHED! Static methods can't access instance variables. Remove 'static' or make result static!

bugs.title: üîç The HashSet Mystery
bugs.description: Object vanishes from HashSet! equals() works but contains() fails. The equals-hashCode contract is broken!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è CONTRACT RESTORED! Override equals? Must override hashCode too! HashSet checks hashCode first.

bugs.title: üåÄ The Infinite Recursion
bugs.description: STACK OVERFLOW! Factorial function calls itself forever because it never stops. Add the emergency brake!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è BRAKE ENGAGED! Every recursion needs a BASE CASE. Add 'if (n <= 1) return 1;' to stop the descent!

bugs.title: üíß The Resource Leak
bugs.description: MEMORY LEAK! File handle never closes if an exception occurs. The resource is bleeding memory!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è LEAK SEALED! Use try-with-resources for automatic cleanup. Java closes the resource for you!

bugs.title: üêå The Slow String Builder
bugs.description: PERFORMANCE CRISIS! Building a string in a loop is taking forever. 10,000 iterations create 10,000 string objects!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SPEED BOOST! String concatenation in loops is O(n¬≤). StringBuilder is O(n) - 100x faster!

bugs.title: ‚úÇÔ∏è The Substring Trap
bugs.description: Trying to get first 3 characters from 'Hi' crashes! The string is too short for our cut.
bugs.brokenCode:
String s = "Hi";
String first3 = s.substring(0, 3);
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SAFE CUT! substring(0,3) needs at least 3 chars. Use Math.min(3, s.length()) for safety!
bugs.fixedCode:
String s = "Hi";
String first3 = s.substring(0, Math.min(3, s.length()));

bugs.title: üî¢ The Float Point Paradox
bugs.description: MATH BROKEN! 0.1 + 0.2 doesn't equal 0.3 in computers. The floating point precision monster strikes!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è PRECISION HANDLED! Floating-point has tiny errors. Compare with epsilon: Math.abs(a - 0.3) < 0.0001

bugs.title: üèéÔ∏è The Race Condition
bugs.description: CRITICAL BUG! Two threads are racing to create the singleton. Sometimes they both win and create two instances!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è RACE WON! Double-checked locking with volatile prevents the race condition!

bugs.title: üêç Python: The Indent Insurgent
bugs.description: Python's whitespace police caught you! The code is rebelling because of improper indentation.
bugs.brokenCode:
def greet(name):
print(f"Hello, {name}!")
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è INDENT CORRECTED! Python uses indentation for code blocks. Everything inside a function needs 4 spaces!
bugs.fixedCode:
def greet(name):
    print(f"Hello, {name}!")

bugs.title: üêç Python: Range Rookie Error
bugs.description: The loop counts to 9 but we need 10! Python's range() has a secret: it excludes the end number.
bugs.brokenCode:
for i in range(10):
    print(i)
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è RANGE MASTERED! range(10) gives 0-9. Use range(11) to include 10!
bugs.fixedCode:
for i in range(11):
    print(i)

bugs.title: üêç Python: The Mutable Default Monster
bugs.description: HORROR STORY: Function remembers items from previous calls! The default list is haunted!
bugs.brokenCode:
def add_item(item, items=[]):
    items.append(item)
    return items

print(add_item('a'))
print(add_item('b'))
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è MONSTER DEFEATED! Default mutable arguments are shared. Use None and create new list inside!

bugs.title: üêç Python: Division Dimension
bugs.description: 7 / 2 gives 3.5 but we want 3! Python 3's division changed the rules.
bugs.brokenCode:
result = 7 / 2
print(result)
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è DIMENSION CROSSED! Use // for integer (floor) division in Python 3!
bugs.fixedCode:
result = 7 // 2
print(result)

bugs.title: üêç Python: String Surgery
bugs.description: Can't change a character in a string! Python strings are frozen - you need a workaround.
bugs.brokenCode:
s = "hello"
s[0] = "H"
bugs.actualOutput: TypeError: 'str' object does not support item assignment
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SURGERY COMPLETE! Strings are immutable. Create a new string with slicing!
bugs.fixedCode:
s = "hello"
s = "H" + s[1:]

bugs.title: üêç Python: Key Not Found
bugs.description: KeyError strikes! Accessing a missing dictionary key crashes the code. Add some protection!
bugs.brokenCode:
data = {"name": "John"}
age = data["age"]
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è KEY PROTECTED! Use .get() for safe dictionary access with a default value!
bugs.fixedCode:
data = {"name": "John"}
age = data.get("age", 0)

bugs.title: üêç Python: The Global Secret
bugs.description: The function tries to modify a global variable but creates a local one instead! Unlock the secret!
bugs.brokenCode:
counter = 0

def increment():
    counter = counter + 1

increment()
print(counter)
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SECRET UNLOCKED! Use the 'global' keyword to modify global variables inside functions!
bugs.fixedCode:
counter = 0

def increment():
    global counter
    counter = counter + 1

increment()
print(counter)

bugs.title: üêç Python: Comprehension Confusion
bugs.description: Syntax error in list comprehension! The if-filter is in the wrong position.
bugs.brokenCode:
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
evens = [x if x % 2 == 0 for x in numbers]
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SYNTAX FIXED! In list comprehension, the filter goes AFTER 'for', not before!
bugs.fixedCode:
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
evens = [x for x in numbers if x % 2 == 0]

bugs.title: üêç Python: The Self Identity Crisis
bugs.description: The class methods forgot who they are! They're missing their 'self' identity.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è IDENTITY RESTORED! Instance methods need 'self' as first parameter!

bugs.title: üêç Python: Catch Too Much
bugs.description: Bare except catches EVERYTHING - even keyboard interrupts! Be more specific.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è EXCEPTION SPECIFIED! Always catch specific exceptions to know what went wrong!

bugs.title: ‚ö° JS: Type Coercion Chaos
bugs.description: 5 equals '5'?! JavaScript's loose equality is playing tricks. Time for strict comparison!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è CHAOS CONTROLLED! == does type coercion. Use === for strict equality!

bugs.title: ‚ö° JS: The Hoisting Haunting
bugs.description: Variable used before declaration shows 'undefined' instead of error! The ghost of var hoisting strikes!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è GHOST EXORCISED! var hoists declarations but not values. Use let/const for clarity!
bugs.fixedCode:
let x = 5;
console.log(x);

bugs.title: ‚ö° JS: The Closure Trap
bugs.description: All buttons log '3' instead of 0, 1, 2! The loop variable is shared by all closures.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è TRAP ESCAPED! var is function-scoped. Use let for block-scoped variables!

bugs.title: ‚ö° JS: Lost 'this' Context
bugs.description: 'this' is undefined in setTimeout! Regular functions lose context. Arrow functions to the rescue!
bugs.actualOutput: TypeError: Cannot read property 'count' of undefined
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è CONTEXT RESTORED! Arrow functions inherit 'this' from parent scope!

bugs.title: ‚ö° JS: Promise Pending Forever
bugs.description: Function returns Promise instead of data! Missing async/await leaves us hanging.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è PROMISE FULFILLED! fetch() is async. Add async/await to wait for results!

bugs.title: ‚ö° JS: forEach Return Trap
bugs.description: Return inside forEach doesn't work! Always returns null. The forEach void strikes!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è ITEM FOUND! forEach ignores returns. Use find() instead!

bugs.title: ‚ö° JS: Object Reference Riddle
bugs.description: The 'copy' is actually the same object! Changes affect both. JavaScript's reference trap!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è COPY MADE! Use spread operator {...obj} for true shallow copy!

bugs.title: üì± Kotlin: Null Safety Violation
bugs.description: Force unwrap (!!) on null crashes! Kotlin's null safety is being bypassed dangerously.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SAFE CALL! Use ?. with ?: for safe null handling. Never use !! in production!

bugs.title: üì± Kotlin: Immutable Data Class
bugs.description: Can't modify val property! Data class properties are immutable. Use the copy() function!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è IMMUTABILITY EMBRACED! Use copy() to create modified data class!

bugs.title: üì± Android: Missing Context
bugs.description: Toast crashes because context is null! Android components need proper lifecycle awareness.
bugs.brokenCode:
// In a fragment
Toast.makeText(getContext(), "Hello", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è LIFECYCLE AWARE! Check if fragment is attached before using context!

bugs.title: üì± Android: UI Thread Violation
bugs.description: Updating UI from background thread crashes! Android UI is single-threaded.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è THREAD SAFE! Use runOnUiThread() or Handler to update UI from background!

bugs.title: üîó Java: StringBuilder Reverse Riddle
bugs.description: String reversal not working as expected! The builder needs proper method chaining.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è REVERSAL COMPLETE! reverse() modifies sb, not s. Get result with sb.toString()!

bugs.title: üóÉÔ∏è SQL: The WHERE Clause Trap
bugs.description: Query returns nothing! The string comparison needs quotes.
bugs.brokenCode: SELECT * FROM users WHERE name = John;
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è QUERY FIXED! String values need single quotes in SQL!
bugs.fixedCode: SELECT * FROM users WHERE name = 'John';

bugs.title: üóÉÔ∏è SQL: NULL Comparison Nightmare
bugs.description: Finding NULL values with = doesn't work! NULL is special in SQL.
bugs.brokenCode: SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = NULL;
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è NULL HANDLED! NULL can't be compared with =. Use IS NULL!
bugs.fixedCode: SELECT * FROM users WHERE email IS NULL;

bugs.title: üóÉÔ∏è SQL: GROUP BY Gotcha
bugs.description: Non-aggregated column in SELECT with GROUP BY causes error!
bugs.actualOutput: Error: name not in GROUP BY
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è GROUPING FIXED! Every non-aggregated column must be in GROUP BY!

bugs.title: üóÉÔ∏è SQL: JOIN Without Condition
bugs.description: JOIN creates cartesian product! Millions of rows instead of expected results.
bugs.brokenCode: SELECT * FROM orders, customers;
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è JOIN PROPER! Use explicit JOIN with ON condition!
bugs.fixedCode:
SELECT * FROM orders
JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.id;

bugs.title: üóÉÔ∏è SQL: LIKE Escape Characters
bugs.description: Searching for % character fails! LIKE treats % as wildcard.
bugs.brokenCode: SELECT * FROM products WHERE discount LIKE '50%';
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è ESCAPE MASTERED! Use ESCAPE clause or bracket: [%]!
bugs.fixedCode: SELECT * FROM products WHERE discount LIKE '50[%]';

bugs.title: üé® HTML: Unclosed Tag Terror
bugs.description: Page layout broken! An unclosed tag is wreaking havoc on the DOM.
bugs.brokenCode: Hello World
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è TAG CLOSED! Always close your tags. HTML5 is forgiving but buggy!
bugs.fixedCode: Hello World

bugs.title: üé® CSS: Specificity Showdown
bugs.description: CSS not applying! Another selector is winning the specificity battle.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SPECIFICITY MASTERED! More specific selectors win. Use !important or increase specificity!
bugs.fixedCode: .container .button.button-primary { color: blue; }

bugs.title: üé® CSS: Flexbox Alignment Puzzle
bugs.description: Items not centering! Flexbox needs both axes aligned.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è FULLY CENTERED! Add align-items: center for vertical centering!

bugs.title: ‚öõÔ∏è React: Missing Key Prop
bugs.description: React warning! List items need unique keys for efficient rendering.
bugs.brokenCode:
items.map(item =>
  • {item.name}
    • )
bugs.actualOutput: Warning: Each child should have unique key
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è KEY ADDED! Use unique identifier as key prop for list items!
bugs.fixedCode:
items.map(item =>
  • {item.name}
    • )

bugs.title: ‚öõÔ∏è React: Infinite useEffect Loop
bugs.description: INFINITE LOOP! useEffect runs forever because dependencies array is missing.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è LOOP STOPPED! Add dependency array. Empty [] for mount only!

bugs.title: ‚öõÔ∏è React: State Mutation Crime
bugs.description: State change not triggering re-render! Mutating state directly is a React crime.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è IMMUTABILITY ENFORCED! Never mutate state. Create new array!
bugs.fixedCode:
const [items, setItems] = useState([]);
setItems([...items, newItem]);

bugs.title: ‚öõÔ∏è React: Stale Closure State
bugs.description: Count stays at 1 even after multiple clicks! Stale closure captured old state.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è FRESH STATE! Use functional update: setCount(c => c + 1)!

bugs.title: üîå API: Missing Error Handler
bugs.description: Unhandled promise rejection! API failure crashes the app silently.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è ERROR HANDLED! Always add .catch() for API calls!

bugs.title: üîå API: Async/Await Try-Catch
bugs.description: Async function errors are uncaught! Try-catch is needed for async/await.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è ASYNC SAFE! Wrap await in try-catch!

bugs.title: üîå API: JSON Parse on HTML
bugs.description: JSON.parse throws error! Server returned HTML (error page) instead of JSON.
bugs.brokenCode: const data = JSON.parse(response);
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SAFE PARSE! Check content-type or handle HTML error pages!

bugs.title: üî¢ Algorithm: Binary Search Bug
bugs.description: Binary search infinite loops! The mid calculation has an off-by-one bug.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è SEARCH FIXED! left = mid causes infinite loop. Use left = mid + 1!

bugs.title: üî¢ Algorithm: Bubble Sort Bug
bugs.description: Sorting incomplete! One pass isn't enough for bubble sort.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è FULLY SORTED! Need nested loops - outer for passes, inner for comparisons!

bugs.title: üî¢ Algorithm: Fibonacci Overflow
bugs.description: Fibonacci returns negative numbers! Integer overflow at large values.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è OVERFLOW FIXED! Use long for larger Fibonacci numbers!

bugs.title: üî¢ Algorithm: Two Sum Timeout
bugs.description: O(n¬≤) solution times out! Need a faster approach using HashMap.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è OPTIMIZED! Use HashMap to achieve O(n) time complexity!

bugs.title: ü§ñ Prompt: Missing Context
bugs.description: AI gives generic response! The prompt lacks specific context and constraints.
bugs.brokenCode: Write code
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è CONTEXT ADDED! Be specific: language, purpose, constraints, examples!
bugs.fixedCode: Write a Python function that validates email addresses using regex. Include test cases.

bugs.title: ü§ñ Prompt: Ambiguous Task
bugs.description: AI misunderstands! The task is too vague and open to interpretation.
bugs.brokenCode: Make it better
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è CLARITY ACHIEVED! Specify WHAT to improve and HOW!
bugs.fixedCode:
Improve this code for readability by:
1. Adding descriptive variable names
2. Adding comments
3. Breaking long functions into smaller ones

bugs.title: ü§ñ Prompt: No Output Format
bugs.description: AI output is messy! No specified format leads to unpredictable responses.
bugs.brokenCode: List some programming languages
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è FORMAT SPECIFIED! Request specific output format: JSON, table, numbered list, etc.!

bugs.title: ü§ñ Prompt: No Examples
bugs.description: AI doesn't understand the pattern! Few-shot examples missing.
bugs.brokenCode: Translate to pirate speak
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è EXAMPLES ADDED! Provide input/output examples for consistent results!
bugs.fixedCode:
Translate to pirate speak:

Example:
Input: Hello friend
Output: Ahoy matey!

Input: I'm going home
Output: I be sailin' to me port!

Now translate:
Input: How are you today?

bugs.title: ü§ñ Prompt: Role Not Defined
bugs.description: AI response lacks expertise! No role or persona defined.
bugs.brokenCode: Explain databases
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è ROLE ASSIGNED! Define AI's role for expert-level responses!
bugs.fixedCode:
You are a senior database architect with 20 years experience.

Explain the trade-offs between SQL and NoSQL databases for a high-traffic e-commerce platform.

Include: scalability, consistency, query complexity, and maintenance considerations.

bugs.title: ‚ú® Clean Code: Magic Numbers
bugs.description: What does 86400 mean? Magic numbers make code unreadable!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è MAGIC REMOVED! Use named constants for clarity!

bugs.title: ‚ú® Clean Code: God Method
bugs.description: 200-line method doing everything! Too many responsibilities violate SRP.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è RESPONSIBILITIES SPLIT! Each method should do one thing well!

bugs.title: ‚ú® Clean Code: Boolean Trap
bugs.description: What does true, false, true mean? Boolean parameters are confusing!
bugs.brokenCode: createUser("John", true, false, true);
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è BOOLEANS NAMED! Use builder pattern or named parameters!
bugs.fixedCode:
User.builder()
    .name("John")
    .isAdmin(true)
    .isActive(false)
    .sendWelcomeEmail(true)
    .build();

bugs.title: üíº Interview: Reverse String Wrong
bugs.description: Off-by-one in string reversal! Missing one character.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è FULL REVERSAL! Change i > 0 to i >= 0 to include first character!

bugs.title: üíº Interview: Palindrome Check
bugs.description: Palindrome check fails! Comparing wrong indices.

bugs.title: üíº Interview: Find Max Wrong
bugs.description: Find max fails for negative numbers! Bad initial value.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è INIT VALUE FIXED! Initialize max with Integer.MIN_VALUE or first element!

bugs.title: üíº Interview: Valid Parentheses
bugs.description: Parentheses validation fails! Just counting isn't enough for proper nesting.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è STACK SOLUTION! Use a stack to track proper nesting!

bugs.title: üíº Interview: Linked List Cycle
bugs.description: Cycle detection runs forever! Need slow/fast pointer technique.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è FLOYD'S TORTOISE & HARE! Use slow/fast pointers to detect cycles!

bugs.title: ‚ö° Java: Stream Filter Order
bugs.description: Stream operations in wrong order cause unnecessary processing!
bugs.brokenCode:
list.stream()
    .map(x -> expensiveOperation(x))
    .filter(x -> x > 100)
    .findFirst();
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è FILTER FIRST! Always filter before expensive map operations!
bugs.fixedCode:
list.stream()
    .filter(x -> x > 100)
    .map(x -> expensiveOperation(x))
    .findFirst();

bugs.title: ‚ö° Java: Optional OrElse Trap
bugs.description: Default value method called even when Optional has value!
bugs.brokenCode: optional.orElse(getDefaultValue());
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è LAZY EVALUATION! Use orElseGet() with lambda for lazy evaluation!
bugs.fixedCode: optional.orElseGet(() -> getDefaultValue());

bugs.title: ‚ö° Java: Parallel Stream Bug
bugs.description: Parallel stream gives wrong count! Shared mutable state isn't thread-safe.
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è THREAD-SAFE COUNT! Use atomic operations or reduce()!

bugs.title: üìù Git: Commit Before Pull
bugs.description: Merge conflict nightmare! Changed files without pulling first.
bugs.brokenCode:
git add .
git commit -m "changes"
git push
# Error: rejected!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è PULL FIRST! Always pull before committing to avoid conflicts!
bugs.fixedCode:
git stash
git pull --rebase
git stash pop
git add .
git commit -m "changes"
git push

bugs.title: üöÄ Performance: N+1 Query
bugs.description: Database crawling! Each user triggers another query. N+1 problem!
bugs.explanation: üéñÔ∏è JOIN FETCH! Use single query with join or batch loading!
bugs.fixedCode:
List<User> users = userRepo.findAllWithOrders();
// @Query with JOIN FETCH or EntityGraph
